venice.lib.parser

Class SensorFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.lib.parser.SensorFileReader

  • public class SensorFileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the possibility to parse a file with information about sensors, namespaces and slots.

    Example 1:

    <?xml version="1.0"?>
    <Sources>
    <Sensor name="Simulator">
      <Namespace name="car">
        <slot name="message" type="sfstring"/>
        <slot name="lane" type="sfint32"/>
        <slot name="speed" type="sffloat"/>
      </Namespace>
    </Sensor>
    </Sources>

    The names should never contain a leading or trailing slash (even for RSB). For RSB needed slashes will be added automatically, when creating informers or handlers.

    Example 2 (brief style):

    <?xml version="1.0"?>
    <Sources>
    <Simulator>
      <car>
        <message type="sfstring"/>
        <lane type="sfint32"/>
        <speed type="sffloat"/>
      </car>
    </Simulator>
    </Sources>

    A XML-element with a 'type' attribute will be parsed as a slot. All parent XML-elements of a slot will be parsed as namespace (except for the topmost).
    If an element has a 'name' attribute, this be used for the slot or the namespace. If it doesn't, the tag-name itself will be used.

      static java.util.ArrayList<AbstractSlot> parse(java.io.File file)
      Reads the content of the given file and parses it into an array of abstract slot definitions.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static java.util.ArrayList<AbstractSlot> parse(java.io.File file)
        Reads the content of the given file and parses it into an array of abstract slot definitions.
        The file content needs to be in a XML-format see the class description for a short example.
        Parameters:
        file - contains the XML-structure with slot-definitions
        Returns:
        an ArrayList with abstract slots
